data.title: Jardins Joan Maragall in Barcelona, Catalunya, Spain
data.meta_description: Jardins Joan Maragall in Barcelona city. Address, nearest metro stops, bus stops and car parking.
data.text:
Page Content

The Jardins Joan Maragall is located on Montjuic hill between between the MNAC and the Barcelona Olympic Stadium. Here you will see an ornate garden with an elegant landscape with avenues lined with huge lush trees, wide green grass areas and attractive colourful flower beds during summer. It also has several ponds, ornamental fountains, various sculptures and plants from French landscape gardening during the 20th century. That is why it is one of the most elegant gardens in Barcelona. Additionally, the gardens surround the AlbÃ©niz Palace, the official residence of Spainâs royal family on their visits to Barcelona.

Unfortunately, you cannot enter the AlbÃ©niz Palace and is only used for special occasions.

Below you will find the address, nearest metro stations, bus stops and parking to Jardins Joan Maragall.

How to get to Jardins Joan Maragall

Metro: EspaÃ±a (Green Line, L3) and (Red Line, L1)

From the metro you will walk about 16 minutes to the gardens.

You could use the HolaBCN card which gives you unlimited travel on the public transport system including metro and MontjuÃ¯c funicular. The HolaBCN card can be purchased online here. Once purchased, you can then collect the physical card at the automated vending machines at any metro station.

Hop on hop off sightseeing tourist bus stop

Nearest stop for Jardins Joan Maragall is "Anella Olimpica" on the red route with the "hop on hop off" sightseeing bus

From the bus stop you will walk about 10 minutes to the gardens.

Public bus
